page.title: 07The A417 Trunk Rd: Fairford
page.content: The A417 is in the north of the SW Fairford area, and runs east-west.The road in this section goes from Cirencester to Lechlade.In the west of this area is the village of Meysey Hampton.Here a road branches off the A417 to the south and another road turns off to the north.Continuing east the road is twisty,passing fields of crops.Two more roads branch to the south.Three farms lead off this road west of Fairford. Waiten Hill,approaching Fairford,is a gentle slope which can be slippery in winter.In Fairford there is an arched stone bridge spanning the River Coln. Travelling through Fairford some shops have frontages on the road,and at times the road becomes congested with traffic,including heavy lorries.
